section.title: Why Use High Availability?
section.para: High availability is recommended for virtual machines running critical workloads.
High availability can ensure that virtual machines are restarted in the following scenarios:

listitem.para: When a host becomes non-operational due to hardware failure.
When a host is put into maintenance mode for scheduled downtime.
When a host becomes unavailable because it has lost communication with an external storage resource.

section.para: A high availability virtual machine is automatically restarted, either on its original host or another host in the cluster.
